Take a window of dates from a chronogram

cg_window_by_metadata.Rd

Works with respect to a column (eg date of dose 3).

Usage

cg_window_by_metadata(cg, windowing_date_col, preceding_days, following_days)

Arguments

cg

a chronogram

windowing_date_col

the column containing reference date (must repeat the date for each row of that individual's record).

preceding_days

used as filter( date > (windowing_date_col - preceding_days) )

following_days

used as filter( date < (windowing_date_col + following_days) )

Value

A windowed chronogram

See also

cg_window_by_episode(), cg_window_by_visit()

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
SevenDaysPrePostDose3 <- cg_window_by_metadata(
  annotatedChronogram, "date_dose_3", 7, 7
)
} # }
